apiDescription:
# Introduction Welcome to TheirStack’s API!
You can use this API to access all our API endpoints, such as the [Jobs endpoint](https://api.theirstack.com) to get real-time and historical jobs from more than 100 countries or the [Companies endpoint](https://api.theirstack.com) to get a list of companies by the technology they use or by the roles they are hiring for. The API is organized around [REST](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/REST). All requests should be made over SSL. All request and response bodies, including errors, are encoded in JSON. # Authentication Authentication is done via the API key which you can find in [your account settings](https://app.theirstack.com/settings/api). When making a call, you’ll have to specify this API key with the Authorization header. Here’s an example: ```sh Authorization: Bearer ```
metaDescription:
TheirStack is a sales tool designed to discover purchase intent signals through job postings. It helps SaaS companies, recruiting agencies and consulting firms find their next customer by analyzing 40 million job listings across 100 countries.

It features instant alerts on new openings, identifies companies based on technology use, and pinpoints those with specific software needs.

Primarily used by sales and marketing teams, it facilitates lead generation and enrichment, targeted marketing, and offers data-driven insights while significantly reducing research time.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Order by field

parameters.name: orderDirection
parameters.description: Order direction

parameters.name: companyNamePartial
parameters.description: Pass a partial company name to filter the list of companies

parameters.name: userIds
parameters.description: Get saved searches from users with these IDs. The IDs must be from people in the current users' team.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Filter by type of search. For example, 'jobs' or 'tech_details'

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Order by field

parameters.name: orderDirection
parameters.description: Order direction

parameters.name: namePattern
parameters.description: Regex pattern of a technology name, case-insensitive

parameters.name: categoryPattern
parameters.description: Regex pattern of a technology category, case-insensitive. For example, `data|storage|queue` to find data tools.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: Slug of one or many technologies

parameters.name: slugs
parameters.description: Slugs of one or many technologies

parameters.name: categorySlug
parameters.description: Slug of a technology category

parameters.name: industry
parameters.description: Name of an industry, case-insensitive. Will return industries that contain the given string either in their name, hierarchy or description

methods.description: Get Jobs And Companies Per Job Country Code

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Name of a country. Will return any countries that contain the given string

methods.description: Get Companies Per Company Country Code

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Name of a country. Will return any countries that contain the given string

parameters.name: categorySlug
parameters.description: Category slug

parameters.name: numTechnologiesPerCategory
parameters.description: Number of technologies per category

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number. Will only apply when not passed in the body

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Will only apply when not passed in the body.

parameters.name: includeTotalResults
parameters.description: Whether to include the total number of results in the response. Will only apply when not passed in the body.

parameters.name: groupBy
parameters.description: Group results by a given field and get the number of jobs per group. If you pass `company`, you'll get the number of jobs per company. If you pass `job_title`, you'll get the number of jobs per job title. If you pass `location`, you'll get the number of jobs per location. Will only apply when not passed in the body

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the response. One of `json` or `csv`. Defaults to `json`.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the response. One of `json` or `csv`. Defaults to `json`.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the response. One of `json` or `csv`. Defaults to `json`.

parameters.name: domains
parameters.description: Comma-sep rated list of domains. Deprecated - use the `companies_urls` parameter instead. You can pass domains, emails or full URLs to it directly.

parameters.name: emails
parameters.description: Comma-sep rated list of emails. Deprecated - use the `companies_urls` parameter instead. You can pass domains, emails or full URLs to it directly.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the response. One of `json` or `csv`. Defaults to `json`.

parameters.name: companiesUrls
parameters.description: Array or comma-separated string containing domains, emails or full URLs.

parameters.name: technologyPattern
parameters.description: Regex pattern to match any of the technologies we track, listed on the /technologies endpoint

parameters.name: jobTitlePattern
parameters.description: Regex pattern to match job titles

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Country name of the company to filter by. Case sensitive

parameters.name: minEmployeeCount
parameters.description: Minimum number of employees

parameters.name: maxEmployeeCount
parameters.description: Minimum number of employees

parameters.name: descriptionPattern
parameters.description: Regex pattern to search in job descriptions. Case insensitive

parameters.name: companiesPattern
parameters.description: Regex pattern to match company names

parameters.name: fromage
parameters.description: Number of days to look back for jobs

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the response. One of `json` or `csv`. Defaults to `json`.

parameters.name: newCompanies
parameters.description:
If `true`, only companies that haven't been fetched by the user will be returned. Credits will be consumed.

If `false`, only companies that have been fetched by the user will be returned. In this case, your call won't consume credits.

If `all`, both new and fetched companies may be returned.

Defaults to `all`

repositoryDescription: TheirStack: Sales tool for intent signals from job postings. Analyzes 40M listings in 100 countries, provides alerts, technology insights, and boosts lead gen for SaaS, recruiters, and consultants. TheirStack's {language} SDK generated by Konfig (https://konfigthis.com/).
